question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute
\[\tan 20^\circ + \tan 40^\circ + \sqrt{3} \tan 20^\circ \tan 40^\circ.\]
inference:
**Solution:**
\begin{align*}
\tan 20^\circ + \tan 40^\circ + \sqrt{3} \tan 20^\circ \tan 40^\circ &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + \frac{\sin 40^\circ}{\cos 40^\circ} + \sqrt{3} \left(\frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}\right)\left(\frac{\sin 40^\circ}{\cos 40^\circ}\right)\\
&= \frac{\sin 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ + \sin 40^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ} + \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sin (20^\circ + 40^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ} + \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sin 60^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ} + \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ} + \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}(1 + \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ)}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}(1 + \frac{1}{2}\sin 80^\circ)}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}(1 + \frac{1}{2})}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}\left(\frac{3}{2}\right)}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{3\sqrt{3}}{4\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}
**Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{3\sqrt{3}}{4\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}}$. I hope it is correct.**

question:
**Solution:**
\begin{align*}
\tan 20^\circ + \tan 40^\circ + \sqrt{3} \tan 20^\circ \tan 40^\circ &= \frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ} + \frac{\sin 40^\circ}{\cos 40^\circ} + \sqrt{3} \left(\frac{\sin 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ}\right)\left(\frac{\sin 40^\circ}{\cos 40^\circ}\right)\\
&= \frac{\sin 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ + \sin 40^\circ \cos 20^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ} + \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sin (20^\circ + 40^\circ)}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ} + \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sin 60^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ} + \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ} + \frac{\sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3} + \sqrt{3} \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}(1 + \sin 20^\circ \sin 40^\circ)}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}(1 + \frac{1}{2}\sin 80^\circ)}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}(1 + \frac{1}{2})}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{\sqrt{3}\left(\frac{3}{2}\right)}{2\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}\\
&= \frac{3\sqrt{3}}{4\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}.
\end{align*}
**Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{3\sqrt{3}}{4\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ}}$. I hope it is correct.**
